class_notes: Feminist Media Studies is designed to provide students with the analytic skillset, language, and theoretical frameworks to explore various forms of media from a feminist perspective. The first half of the course is dedicated to unpacking and analyzing the following questions/debates: What is feminist media studies and why is it important? What sets a feminist approach to media apart from standard criticism? What feminist theories can we use to evaluate and analyze media? What makes a piece of media "feminist"? How does identity factor into a feminist media studies analysis? How has the internet, and specifically social media, disrupted and/or facilitated feminism's ends? Once the groundwork is established, the second half of the course is dedicated to applying feminist media studies' theories and methods to a variety of films, television shows, visual art, podcasts, records, memes, zines, and other forms of media. The course will culminate in a final project in which students will either analyze or produce a piece of media of their choosing, with appropriate guidance and sign-off from the instructor.
